meanings.definition: To bring a ship into a dock for repairs or loading/unloading.
meanings.sent1: The captain skillfully guided the ship for docking at the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The workers will be docking the cargo ship at the port tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked that the ship was so good at docking, it could park itself.
meanings.sent4: The ship's docking maneuver was as precise as a surgeon's scalpel.
meanings.sent5: The docking process was like fitting puzzle pieces together perfectly.

meanings.definition: To connect or join two objects together.
meanings.sent1: I will be docking the two pieces of wood to build a birdhouse.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut will be docking the spacecraft with the space station.
meanings.sent3: The magnets seemed to enjoy docking together, forming a strong bond.
meanings.sent4: Her words and actions docked perfectly, creating a seamless presentation.
meanings.sent5: The idea of docking the two ideas seemed impossible until she found a way.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting off the tail of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The vet performed the docking on the puppy's tail to prevent future injuries.
meanings.sent2: The farmer learned the proper technique for docking sheep tails.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of a tail docking party for the animals.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the evil witch's punishment was a magical docking of her tail.
meanings.sent5: The docking of the tail was a common practice among certain dog breeds.

meanings.definition: A device used to connect electronic devices.
meanings.sent1: The new docking station made it easy to charge multiple devices at once.
meanings.sent2: She plugged her phone into the docking station to sync her music.
meanings.sent3: The tech-savvy teenager proudly showed off his latest docking invention.
meanings.sent4: The docking device revolutionized the way people connected their gadgets.
meanings.sent5: The docking system seamlessly integrated all her devices for easy access.
